sentence.content: BFN Berlin -- Erich Honecker, the former GDR head of state, died at his house in Santiago, Chile on Sunday morning , according to his lawyer.

sentence.content: Lawyer Nicolas Becker, who had represented 81-year-old Honecker before the Berlin court in 1992 and early 1993, told DPA on Sunday afternoon that Honecker had rejected an operation.

sentence.content: His colleague, Wolfgang Ziegler, had said earlier that the former most powerful man in the GDR had obviously died from his liver cancer.

sentence.content: Becker said he did not know whether Honecker has left a will or where the funeral would be held.

sentence.content: He also said he cannot say whether Margot Honecker, who had informed Becker of her husband&apost;s death, will be allowed to stay in Chile.
